185858210.review:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/king9shalopai/recommended/70/]Плюсы и минусы основной игры описаны здесь.[/url]

Я долгое время не хотел проходить HLS из-за многочисленных жалоб на баги, вызванных обновлением 2013 года. Но в 2023 году Steam исполнилось 20 лет, Valve устроили по такому поводу распродажу, и я решил докупить некоторые игры любимого разработчика. Я только что прошёл игру и готов сказать, что это просто ужас.

Минусы:
1) Щупальца в принципе не наносят урона.
2) Графические артефакты в главах Residue Processing и [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3409585277]Surface Tension[/url].
3) Вместо следа плевка Гонарча появляется чёрный квадрат.
4) После первого ранения охранники постоянно орут от боли, даже если не получают урон.
5) В 2 главе скрипт открытия двери охранником работает только 1 раз.
6) По какой-то причине Valve не захотели вставлять фразы персонажей в субтитры (от чего они становятся бесполезными).
7) Другие игроки жалуются на хитбокс вертолёта в "Поверхностном натяжении", но у меня лично проблем не было.
8) Игра не запускается на Steam Deck. Проходить шутеры от первого лица на контроллерах - такое себе, но момент - довольно показательный.
9) Серый интерфейс, хотя в оригинале он был зелёным.

Плюсы (ситуацию они не сильно спасают, но тем не менее):
1) Контент для Garry's Mod.
2) Внезапно вентилятор в Blast Pit и прыжок Гонарча в яму прекрасно работают! А вот в Steam версии оригинальной игры они постоянно ломаются (по крайней мере у меня).
3) Возможность выбрать любую главу.

Спустя 10 лет после печально известного обновления Valve решили скрыть игру из поиска вместо того, чтобы починить игру, нормально внедрив Steam Pipe (собственно из-за него игра и не работает корректно). В целом Half-Life: Source можно пройти, но покупать я не рекомендую. [spoiler]Только если на распродажах урвать за копейки.[/spoiler]

185031575.review:
the nicest thing i can say about actually playing the current unpatched steam version of half life source is that the astonishing number of bugs and glitches that this version has piled up can actually be used to your advantage should you know about them. with proper knowledge of how to exploit hl:source, you can transform this port that otherwise looks like a virus masquerading as half life into a breeze of a game to do a fast run of, and a pretty fun one at that. 

that's literally the best thing i can say that isn't just directing you to harvesting its assets for modding purposes or getting your hands on an older release/community patch that allows half life source to actually shine as a decent alternative way to play the original game.

183821141.review:
Now, before you get extremely mad at me, just hear me out.

Half-Life Source is not that bad. Sure, it's got overly glossy materials in some areas, and has some visual bugs at certain points, but as long as you finish the classic half-life first before playing this, then I think it's worth getting.

If you haven't got original half-life and are thinking of getting this for the first time instead of classic half-life DON'T!!! Though that's unlikely since this game is delisted now. I got this game in the full half-life pack with BS and OF {The expansions} This game was just an extra, honestly, worth it. This game is madly overhated. If you've played half life, you should try it.

183727781.review: This is probably the worst way to experience the original Half Life. It's extremely buggy, with graphical effects warping constantly depending on the level. The enemies that hang on the ceiling have their tongues disappear randomly, so you get caught by them with no way to avoid it. All the new models look even more like lifeless diseased corpses than before. Everyone legit looks like they are suffering from Leukemia. The weapon shine is also pretty horrible. Play the original instead or Black Mesa if dated graphics bother you.

183587491.review:
Half-Life: Source – A Classic Revamped for Modern Times:


Half-Life: Source takes the legendary 1998 FPS classic and breathes new life into it using the powerful Source engine. While the core story and gameplay remain the same—following Gordon Freeman as he battles aliens and government soldiers in the infamous Black Mesa research facility—the enhanced graphics and physics make the experience feel fresh and more immersive than ever.

The game features improved textures, lighting, and physics, all while maintaining the tense atmosphere and groundbreaking gameplay that made the original so iconic. Fans of the original Half-Life will appreciate the familiar yet enhanced experience, while newcomers can dive into this revolutionary shooter with more polished visuals and smoother mechanics.

If you’re looking to relive one of the most influential shooters of all time, Half-Life: Source is the perfect way to experience it with a modern touch. It’s the classic that defined a genre, now with an upgraded look and feel!

183554264.review: I got softlocked in the first 15 minutes because I got stuck inside of a scientist, that about sums up the quality of this game. There's not many reasons to play this over the original. The only benefit to owning it is being able to use the assets in GMod, but that's kinda it. Sure you can fix most of the glitches and issues with mods, but why even bother when there's another version of the game that's already fixed? There's a charm to it though, the ragdolls are funny and all of its quirks make it an interesting experience. I would only recommend getting the game when it's heavily discounted if you want to experience its weirdness and have its assets available in GMod (then again I would only really recommend buying any Valve game when they're heavily discounted LOL), but otherwise if you want to actually want "the true Half-Life experience," you should probably just play the original. HOWEVER, even if it is a buggy, messy version of Half-Life, it's still Half-Life. It's perfectly playable and most of the glitches don't drastically ruin the experience, not to mention it has a few of its own merits like the ragdolls or improved lighting. It's a fine and serviceable, albeit not definitive, way to play the game. You're probably better off playing the original, but this is an option.

183517506.review: they got rid of the extremely loud echo for when you shoot in an enclosed space
